DEFINITION: Proprietary method of testing total acidity of wine by using a weighted average
Marketing Score indicating the appeal of label design for consumers. High numbers suggest customers like the label design. Negative numbers suggest customes don't like the design.
THEORETICAL EFFECT: Many consumers purchase based on the visual appeal of the wine label design. Higher numbers suggest better sales.

DEFINITION: Wine rating by a team of experts. 4 Stars = Excellent, 1 Star = Poor
THEORETICAL EFFECT: A high number of stars suggests high sales
